Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Disease or Disorder/Disorder by Site/Urinary System Disorder/Renal Disorder/Non-Neoplastic Renal Disorder/Nephropathy/Focal Segmental Glomerulosclerosis
Male Urogenital Diseases/Urologic Diseases/Kidney Diseases/Nephritis/Glomerulonephritis/Glomerulosclerosis, Focal Segmental
Record.BroaderTerm: Female Urogenital Diseases and Pregnancy Complications
Record.Description: A clinicopathological syndrome or diagnostic term for a type of glomerular injury that has multiple causes, primary or secondary. Clinical features include PROTEINURIA, reduced GLOMERULAR FILTRATION RATE, and EDEMA. Kidney biopsy initially indicates focal segmental glomerular consolidation (hyalinosis) or scarring which can progress to globally sclerotic glomeruli leading to eventual KIDNEY FAILURE.Segmental glomerular degeneration with a glassy appearance (hyalinosis) caused by the accumulation of plasma proteins in the glomeruli.
